result.execSummary:
The defendant Sonja E Acevedo was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Pay $500.00 fine plus court costs. Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for one (1) year.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
COC COLLECT 
---------------------

Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge. 
-----------------

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sonja E Acevedo

records.addlTxt: Defendant Sonja E Acevedo in court.  Attorney Obi Uzowulu in court for Sonja E Acevedo.  Prosecuting attorney J J. Crawford in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant plead guilty to count #1, Plea questionnaire/waiver of rights filed. Court finds factual basis, accepts plea and adjudges defendant guilty. Defendant does not make statement. Court gives warning to deportation. Court sentences defendant. Minutes filed.
Authorization to Appear and Act Obi Uzowulu

Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Sonja E Acevedo not in court.  Attorney Obi Uzowulu in court for Sonja E Acevedo. Defendant needs to complete 25 hours of community service work.
Status conference scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Sonja E Acevedo in court.  Attorney Obi Uzowulu in court for Sonja E Acevedo.   
Offer includes community service to be completed up front, which is done, proof is needed. Minutes filed.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
EFFECTIVE DATE OF THIS ASSIGNMENT IS AUGUST 1, 2022.

Prosecuting attorney Zeke S Wiedenfeld in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Sonja E Acevedo in court.  Attorney Obi Uzowulu in court for Sonja E Acevedo. Agreement reached. Defendant to do 25 hours of CSW. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Prosecuting attorney James T. Sempf in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Sonja E Acevedo in court.  Attorney Obi Uzowulu in court for Sonja E Acevedo. Still negotiating. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant is to be booked and printed within twenty-four (24) hours. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
Scheduling Order will be provided to Attys via e-filing by the Court

Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Sonja E Acevedo appeared in court, Attorney Obi Uzowulu for Sonja E Acevedo appeared in court. Defendant given complaint; charges/penalties explained by the court. Reading of complaint waived. Not guilty plea entered and trial reserved. Minutes filed.
